Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, poor rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mindaugas L
Reviews.Content: Location is fine because it's very close to Central Station, and it's in a beautiful Venice :) but it is far from Main Square and Basilica. Hotel itself is really quite poor but since everything in Venice is very expensive it can be considered as a cheap acommodation in the convenient place. Not much comfort though - room is very small, there's hardly a space to turn around. Same for bed - very short and narrow, you could call it Italian type or just uncomfortable sleep. Walls are thin, you can hear other guests speaking in the next room. Breakfast poor, but coffee was very good, just you have to ask for espresso, because as default they bring americana which sucks. Fair value for money in one of the most beautiful(and expensive) places on Earth which is Venice :)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel at a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Cornhusker001
Reviews.Content: Location: very close (5-min walking) to the train station and the Piazzale Roma bus station, from the later there are two shuttle buses to/from the Marco Polo Airport every 20 minutes. You need to cross only two small bridges to the Piazzale Roma bus station or one slightly larger bridge to the train station. This may be very beneficial if you have heavy luggage. From the hotel, you can essentially walk to anywhere in the city within half an hour. Particularly, there are many eateries/restaurants near the train station so you don't need to worry about find places to eat late in the evening. Facility: The rooms are not big with the U.S. standard but are more than adequate if you are not very big (over 250-300 pounds). There are a couple of bigger rooms and you may check with the staff to see if such rooms are available. My wife and I stayed twice in the hotel (before and after a cruise trip), first in a standard room and the second time in a big room. We felt very comfortable with both stays. For big people, the shower may be a little bit small but should still be manageable. The rooms are recently remodeled and do not feel old at all. Breakfast: Some people commented that the breakfast was continental type. It was simple but I think that it was pretty good, definitely not continental. The setting are nice and you have a variety of things to select. You can ask for different coffees to be served (rather than get from a big bottle by yourself). I found the hotel from Rick Steves' tour book. I emailed the hotel a couple of times before I booked. Each time I got very prompt response from Michaela and/or Giocomo, who run the hotel (also named in Steves' book). My wife and I chatted with Michaela a couple of times and also had some brief chatting with several other staff. All are very nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: trippy25624
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location - just a few blocks from the Piazzale Roma, and right across the river from the train station - you will be coming into Venice through one of these places. Park at the Tronchetto and take the people mover to the Piazzale Roma, then walk to the hotel. This hotel is down a quiet street, but only about a block off the Grand Canal. The accommodations are pretty modest - not alot to rave about, but a very reasonable price for the location. I didn't think we'd be able to stay inside the city for a decent price. There was no elevator, so you had to take your luggage up a narrow flight of stairs, but it wasn't bad. It's been a couple months, so I don't remember the breakfast, but I think it was decent - a typical continental. The wi-fi wasn't working the first night, but did the second. The older gentleman that checked us in was very pleasant, but didn't speak English very well. The nice lady there did. I would likely stay here again given the price and location, unless I have plenty of money and am willing to splurge on a higher-end place.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Wheels96
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located for both the Piazzale Roma bus station and the rail station. From Marco Polo Airport the ATVO direct bus service that costs 5 euros, and takes 20 minutes to Piazzale Roma. Tickets can be purchased in the arrivals hall and validated at the yellow box next to the ATVO stop that is located directly outside of the arrivals hall. From Piazzale Roma do not cross the large bridge over the Grande Canal but the smaller green bridge to the side. Walk for a few minutes with the Grande Canal on your left crossing small waterways, but do not go as far as the Ponte Degli Scalzi bridge over the Grande Canal near the train staion. The hotel is located behind the church to your right and you could easily walk past the doorway as it is poorly signposted externally with only a small "ALBERGO" visible on a low side panel. Our room was very small with only about 30 centimetres passage between end of bed and bathroom wall, but a plus point was that there was a new modern shower installed. As is quite common in Italy there is no tea making facility within the room, but there is a price list available for beverages from the hotel. However, when we asked for coffee after arriving we were told that there was no one in the kitchen. Except for muesli and yoghurt the breakfast was complete "stodge", and this was probably the worst breakfast I have ever had in a hotel. Also there are not really enough breakfast tables for the number of rooms. However, the location close to bus and rail station is excellent, and for travellers who are looking for a clean basic hotel at not too steep a cost this can be a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Ensuite Bathrooms? NONSENSE. Not in our room!”
Reviews.Author: ruthli_11
Reviews.Content: For the price and location the room was fine. Beds were very narrow and hard. But the hotel is quiet and in a very good location. I'm not usually one to whine about hotels if I'm not paying 4star prices but this bathroom was the worst bathroom I've ever experienced in my life and I've lived in some pretty grotty student flats in my time. Absolutely NONEXISTENT water pressure, disgusting old shower cabin with a corroded old showerhead that allowed minimal water out. Probably could have done a better job rinsing shampoo out in the bidet. The bathroom also stunk like nothing on earth. Disgusting. I felt dirtier after my shower than before. A comment/complaint at check out time was basically greeted with a "that's tough [--]" attitude. So much for this "we've renovated our bathrooms" they mention on their website... We tried the communal bathroom on the same floor and it was just as disgusting. Shame as the hotel was ok apart from this.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive...”
Reviews.Author: SuperSongoku
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews, and it is overrated. It is too expensive, though its situated in the centre. You can get a better choice in mestre or in padua. Considering the fact that venice doesnt really offer something for the nightlife, there is no reason staying in venice until late. So you can go back to mestre or padua for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Revitalka
Reviews.Content: Really liked the location, it's close to the train station and to the main "water lane" of the city. The room was OK....a little moldy....but you can not expect anything more than that for this price in Venice. It was fine for a couple nights and breakfast was satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location and excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Stahl_D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Albergo Marin for 4 nights this August and would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff is terrific. The rooms are well appointed (they just got Air Conditioning !), clean and comfortable. Loved the location and the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: 45563002elaine
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station, bus and the vaporetto. Breakfast could be improved but staff are very prompt and friendly. I had the room at the top of the stairs and I think it was the best of the ones that I saw. I had the fewest stairs to climb with my bags and being solo that was a bonus. I like the room and it was larger than others. Bathroom fine for me but my husband would have been claustrophobic. Air conditioning being installed as our group was leaving and that will be an asset given the noise from the open windows from the garbage collection and deliveries early in the morning. Lobby a bit shabby in comparison with the hotels in Rome and especially Florence. That matters since wireless works only in lobby most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: KathCasey
Reviews.Content: I understand that because Venice is very busy during summer and consequently value for money accommodations may be hard to find. I'll try to take this into consideration for my review of Albergo Marin as it is overpriced by international standards. Albergo Malin is in a good location - just outside the main touristy (crowded) area and close to the train station. The rooms are small and seem cramped with unnecessary furniture but the bathrooms are clean and spacious. Aircon was being installed during our stay which would make the rooms more pleasant. Unfortunately, the staff seemed moody and, at times, not too friendly or welcoming. They were either nice or dismissive. However, the petite blonde lady who served in the breakfast room was always friendly and nice. She greeting us warmly every morning that we saw her during our stay and she stood out in comparison to her colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel - close to station and the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: grahamfin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Marin for 2 nights 17th & 18th May 2011. Staff very helpful with booking and continued good service when we arrived. Hotel in a great location - only a five minute walk from train or coach station - clean well appointed rooms - quiet at night - we ate at Al Bacco Felice - only a 2 minute walk away - great food and value!. The only slight reservation we would have is that breakfast opens at 8.00 and judging by the queue at 7.45 it would be better if opened earlier! Overall - very good - would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Located close to train and bus station”
Reviews.Author: honeybee313
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Marin on our last night in Venice after spending 2 nights at a hotel near San Marco. We wanted to be closer to the bus station so that we could easily catch the bus to the airport the next morning. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a polite young gentlemen who spoke excellent English. Later that night when my husband took a shower, we discovered that the shower leaked profusely and our room was flooded. My husband tried to ask the staff member for more towels and explain the situation, but he did not speak a word of English and so he was unsuccessful and we did not get any more towels. The next morning when we showered the situation was repeated and we spent the morning wading through an inch deep of water in the bathroom and trying to stop it from getting near the rest of the room with our 2 towels. I can't comment on the breakfast because we had to leave early the next morning before it was served. Based on our experience with the room flooding due to a leaky shower I cannot recommend the hotel but if we didn't have this problem it would have been just fine. The hotel is very close and easy to find from both the bus and train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, close to station, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JeremyA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a tour group in March 2010 and it was a great experience. I stayed in a double bedroom on the 3rd floor with a private washroom. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The TV's and internet didn't work very well, but hey, I didn't come to Venice to watch TV! Breakfast was included, and we got some pretty good seemingly-fresh croissants with various fruits/berries baked into them, but some other elements of the breakfast were just store-bought and kind of stale. No complaints with the coffee. Location is super, 5 minutes from the station, and if you get up early you can sit outside and watch the commuters rushing by on their way to work. Only issue I had was with some rowdy folks talking loudly in the alleyway under my window until late into the night, but that wasn't the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel room but a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jodi_Shaun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Marin for two nights. The hotel is a five minute walk from the train station and is very easy to find using the hotels directions. We stayed in room 209 which was a double room and we shared a bathroom. The toilet and shower are separate and were down the hallway from our room. I think only two rooms share the bathroom which is good as it was always free. The room was quite small but it was clean and bed was nice and comfortable. The room had a television and a basin. The hotel provides free Wifi but we couldn't access it from our room on the second floor so used it in the lounge area instead. Breakfast was also included. The location of the hotel is fantastic. There are some nice restaurants in very close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: everywhereiroam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night only. The hotel is clean and breakfast is good. The location as it is bang opposite the railway station. We called up the hotel when we arrived here for directions to reach to this place. You have to cross the bridge (white) and enter the lane next to the green dome monument. The bridge has stairs and no ramp, therefore you will have to pick up your luggage all the way across the bridge. When we arrived at the hotel we were told to move to another hotel which was located on the opposite side of the canal, which meant we had to carry out bags across the bridge again. We told them that are bookings were confirmed a week back and they could have told us this when we called them from the station to take directions. They had to accomodate us in this hotel but the room was given late around 5 pm when the standard check in time is 1 am. There were more such disgruntled travellers sitting in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Basic no-frills hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: kari530
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was pretty non-descript as is the hotel and room. It's a no-frills hotel but that' reflected in the price. Our room was clean, the breakfast was good, and location was great....easy 5 minute walk from train station and only had to carry luggage over one bridge. If we ever go back to Venice, I'd stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The terribel experience!”
Reviews.Author: xmingwang
Reviews.Content: This is the worst room in our Italy trip in Aug. 2010. The room we got is not a hotel room, but a loft. Inside the room, there is a large bed with a basin and two small chairs. Nothing more. No air-conditioning under 90+ degree, no toilets, and even no a table... We had to walk through a corridore and passed several rooms to get to a toilet and a bath room. We had to close the window because there were mosquito. Waited to next early morning and hope the mosquito might be in sleep, we opened the window, then the neighborhood began noise. I was confused with my online booking before I left for Italy. I needed to talk to the receptionist. But I was rudely told that it was a only room they had now. I asked why we were given such a loft. His reply was the price was different! I paid Euro 70 for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Price, NO AC!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sierraoneill
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reviewing Trip Advisor, and settled mostly because of location (a very quick 5 minute walk from the train station) We enjoyed our stay in all respects except for a couple. The hotel was advertised as having Air Conditioning, however we were sad to realize that what they considered Air Conditioning was acctually only a fan :( Venice is incredibly Hot in July so this became quite the bummer. At 2 AM our room was still nearly 93F.. making for very poor night sleep. We would have changed hotels but we had to pre pay when we reserved. Other than that the other compaint was that the Lock box/ in room safe was not bolted to the ground, and it was a key opperated (not a self set combo lock), and you had to leave the key at the front desk... so it was about as secure as just putting valuables in your suitcase. On the positive side, it was convienient to get to and from the train station, as well as to find your way back while exploring the streets of Vencie (where it so easy to just get lost!) I would reccomend this hotel if you go to Venice the weather is not HOT (ie. not for June, July, or August)

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean sheet, clean and cosy environment, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jengka7
Reviews.Content: great location, clean sheet, clean and cosy environment, friendly staff - what else do you need? choose the right timing and you will get a good price... but mind you, there is curfew; main door will be locked at 1230midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mixed review”
Reviews.Author: LucyPie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is terrific. About an 8 minute walk to the Grand Canal and the railway station (Ferruvia). The room is not huge, but more spacious than many. The hotel has free Wi-Fi. Their website says it is available in the common areas, but it also works all over the hotel and at the tables just outside the front door. The room rate (we paid 110.50 Euros per night) includes a decent breakfast - cereal, yogurt, juices, brioche, coffee, tea. There is no elevator, so we were happy with our first floor (one flight up) room. The rooms have TVs but you have to give a deposit for the remote control. The bathroom has a hair dryer, but ours did not work and there was no effort or promise made to repair it while we are here. On our third day, the cleaning staff missed our room altogether and we had to go ask for clean towels. The desk clerk acted like that was just the way it goes. He did deliver 2 fresh towels, but was otherwise nonplussed about it. We came by bus from Marco Polo airport which dropped us at the Piazzale de Roma and it is a very short walk from there to the hotel - but it is super confusing if you do not know Venice at all. Apparently when they say take the first left, for example, they mean the first left even if it looks like the skinniest little non-street alleyway you ever saw! So we probably went 3x as far lugging our bags to get to the hotel than we needed to on arrival. NOW we see how easy it is. We just had no concept of the lay of the land...or water, as the case may be. So, we like the hotel, would recommend it, but with the proviso that there were a couple annoyances. Minor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: APaoli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely convenient to the train station. As charming as the small streets and bridges of Venice are, when you have a lot of luggage you don't want to hike to your hotel. Albergo Marin feels like you are staying with an old friend, they are there for anything you need but are not overbearing. The room was very clean and both the room and the bathroom had more room than I expected. There are not a lot of hotels in this area so you feel more like a local and there is no noise at night which was greatly appreciated after long hours wandering around Venice. The staff was amazing! Both my husband and I speak little to no Italian but everyone on staff spoke English. They gave us great advice on restaurants that locals frequent that didn't break the bank. It was also nice staying away from St Mark's Square, the vapporetta stop was close if we didn't feel like walking but we stumbled across some beautiful places just wandering without a destination in mind. Breakfast at the hotel was good as well, standard for a bed and breakfast but the coffee is amazing and they will make it for you any time of day! I can't say enough about this hotel and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: Advisor1967
Reviews.Content: GOOD Immaculately clean ( see caveat below ). Very convenient location less than 5 minutes walk to SL train station across one bridge of Grand Canal. Also very convenient location less than 10 minutes walk ( with luggage ) from the bus station ( for airport connections ), across two minor bridges. The airport bus is currently #5 but confusingly doesnâ€™t stop at stand 5 â€“ you have to look at the timetables on each stand. Close to a good selection of shops, restaurants and ice cream ! Reasonably quiet. The only time we heard any noise at night was on a Saturday when some outside tables about 50m away were hosting drinking customers until the bar closed. The rest of the time we kept the windows open. Compare that to many other hotels that sit directly above restaurants or bars and you are unlikely to find something similar unless you go for a 4* + hotel. Good breakfast. Room provided to store luggage in on day of departure with toilet facilities available too. NOT SO GOOD The only downside to the location is its distance from the main Rialto / San Marco area â€“ which is a good 30 minute walk away â€“ something to consider if you have very young children or are elderly. Then again if money is no problem the Grand Canal water boat stop outside the main station is very close. Walking the back streets allows you to explore the city, and after 2 or 3 goes you soon find your way a lot easier. Bedroom space rather limited. This is OK for a weekend break but might cause problems if you are visiting for a week or more. Although the room, linen, bathroom etc were spotless, previous guests had swatted mosquitoes and flies in our room. The hotel would be wise to clean these up occasionally as it does distract from the otherwise perfect appearance. This also is a warning not to open your window shutters at night whilst lights are on unless you wish to be dive bombed by insects in your sleep. TIPS Remember to validate train, bus ( inc. Airport ones â€“ half hour service ) and boat tickets in yellow machines before boarding. Use a co-op food store 10 minutes from the hotel for stocking up on soft drinks and water. The hotel also sells soft drinks and beer at reasonable prices. If money runs short also buy some rolls, crisps etc and sit out at a convenient spot for lunch. Navigate streets using signs for Rialto and San Marco. Donâ€™t be afraid to ask for help â€“ everyone is friendly especially if you attempt some Italian words. Be prepared to pay > 6 euros for a beer at the Grand Canale and 3 euros for a two scoop ice cream cone. An independent boat trip to Murano island is well worth doing. Avoid costly guided tours and explore it yourself. When you check bags into the cloakroom before visiting the San Marco Basilica, you get a card to go straight to the front of the queue â€“ like a Disney FastPass. Donâ€™t join the main queue which could take hours. Inside, the steps to the external balcony where you can take photos is just to the right of the main entrance â€“ cost is 4 euros pp. When you visit Doges Palace, clean toilets are on the first floor. Avoid the ones next to the bag cloakroom on the ground floor â€“ they are filthy. Visit the San Marco tower last thing in the afternoon when most of the large queues have gone away. If you travel on trains watch that you buy the right ticket for the service â€“ the ones for regional trains are not accepted on intercity trains and vice versa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mkb952
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights while in Venice. Very friendly staff and only a 5 minute walk from train station. Venice can be a maze of canals and little streets but once you get your bearings can walk to Rialto bridge in 10-15 minutes. Comfortable rooms and good breakfast in a charming old buiding. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pedhimself
Reviews.Content: Nice place, quiet and ideally located. Friendly staff and clean.. Breakfast is simple but enough. Can always ask for more coffee

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Owens82
Reviews.Content: The location is good for both the train station and buses. The room was very small and difficult to move around, there was a sink in the room. We had a shared bathroom in which the shower did not drain. Hand towels in the toilet were not replaced. Very poor coffee with breakfast

Reviews.Title: “5 minutes from the train station and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: gabos1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute, but it was a very nice stay. The rooms was big and we had a private bathrooms. The staff was nice and helpful. Locate in a quiet street of Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Good location, grat breakfast, small room”
Reviews.Author: british_eh
Reviews.Content: We were glad that it was only 5 minutes to the hotel from the SM train station. The rooms are average, and alhough we had a WC, we also used the one down the hallway. The breakfast was very good, and the kids were happy to have a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Harleyboy2009
Reviews.Content: A five minute walk from the train station including towing luggage. Very easy to find located near both train and bus station. Our room was on the small side but very clean and tastefully decorated and the view was beautiful. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Sevag spoke very good english and went out of his way to assist guests and frequently lost tourists. Breakfast was your typical Italian croissants, cereal, juice, and coffee which was very fresh and enjoyable. Price is great. We would not hesitate to stay here again and will recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CosmicKidNZ
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel near Piazzale Roma. It is about 5-10 mins walk from Piazzale Roma where the airport buses stop. It is a little hard to find the first time but everything is hard to find in Venice. We were on 2nd floor and there was no lift but taking the bags up was not too hard. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was simple but adequate. Rooms were clean and tidy and bathroom functional. The location is good to catch the water bus - just cross over the bridge to Santa Lucia station/Ferrovia to go anywhere. Good value for money here.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!”
Reviews.Author: cathytravels
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 2 star hotel with a lot of local charm and ambience in a great quiet location. Walk to/from the rail station, yet still located over the bridge, in the more prestigious area, as opposed to the hotels on the rail station side. Very easy to find this hotel. You will appreciate this as you watch flusterd travellers, pulling suitcases, getting cranky while navigating a confusing maze of streets in search of their hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff is very helpful. Breakfast while sparse is acceptable quality. You can not beat this hotel for Value in Venice. On a tight budget but looking for a fantastic buy? A gem? Look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay....quiet, cozy and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: scottishirishpirate
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend, now fiancee and I stayed at this hotel in Venice in early August. It is in a great location for a number of reasons. First, it is off the main streets so it is quiet at night allowing you to keep the windows open to get a fresh, cool breeze at night without having to worry about noise, light waking you up. Second, very close to train station for arrival and departures. Third, very close to cannegegio district which has a lot of great little shops, internet, and lots of good restaurants within walking distance. Fourth, the breakfast in the morning is a great way to start the day (cereal,granola, yogurt, croissants, bicotte and they bring you whatever beverage you like(coffee, espresso, cappuchino,etc.). Fifth, the staff are very friendly. Finally, the cost is very reasonable given the breakfast, location, etc. It is a great place to stay without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay near train station”
Reviews.Author: Duchess_of_Henley
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now. It is very convenient to the train station and easy to find, which is not always the case with hotels in Venice. The room I had this time was very small with toilet and shower in separate rooms down the hall, but clean and quite adequate for my needs. It also had a fan and small TV. Didn't try the TV, but the fan was useful. The hotel is on a quiet alley so we were able to leave our window open for air. I was concerned about mosquitoes, but didn't have any problems. Paid 80 Euros for a double, including breakfast, but left early so can't comment on the breakfast. English-speaking, pleasant staff. There is a room for luggage storage. Did not see a computer for guest access, but did not ask. I would stay here again and really like having a place to drop my bag near the train station instead of having to lug it on the boats and across Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Save money with this hotel so you can blow the rest on shopping!”
Reviews.Author: BamaTraveler2
Reviews.Content: First thing you must know about Venice is the hotels are very expensive. Before traveling to Venice I found that this hotel had some of the lowest rates around Venice, which is true. I convinced my wife to sacrifice a little on the hotel so I could take her on better dinners and buy her more gifts. That is exactly what I would recommend to folks that don't have to be pampered every bit of the way. The rooms are spotless, the capuccino in the mornings was A+, bed was comfortable, the fan kept us cool in early June heat, no bugs, and the location can not be beat. You must consider location if you are carrying bags in Venice. The bridges that span the city are not smooth inclines, they are steps that can be hard to navigate with luggage. The neighborhood was great. I don't think there is a bad neighborhood in Venice though. Overall this hotel delivered on my expectations 100%. I docked them a point due to the night watchman that was really grumpy as a previous reviewer noted. Not a big deal, but he didn't set a great example as our first contact in a new city late at night.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel and would stay here again .”
Reviews.Author: momfromTX
Reviews.Content: I have kept meaning to give this lovely little hotel a recommendation. So even though it's been awhile, I thought that I should give one any way. I was very impressed overall with everything that this hotel had. I was so fortunate to be able to travel with my daughter when she was stationed in Italy. It was wonderful that it was so close to the train station.The front desk was so helpful on where to eat. We stayed 2 nights. The first day he recommended a cafeteria to eat at not to far away. It was very responsibly priced. The next night we again asked for suggestions on where to eat and again were given a the name of the restaurant and directions. IT was a wonderful restaurant and I would eat there again. The breakfast in the mornings were more than adequate. Order coffee or in my case cappuccino and it was brought right away to me after I had ordered it. The continental breakfast consisted of typical food , cereal and pastries,etc.. The room we stayed in was very clean. We had our own shower, and the bathroom was right across the hall form us. So, unless things have changed since then I would give this hotel a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “great place to rest your head!”
Reviews.Author: mngirl81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while doing a two day tour of Venice. We came in on the train, from Santa Lucia. The hotel was super easy to find, and no more than a 5 minute walk from the train station. It was a 30-40 minute walk to St. Marks square, but we loved the walk because we saw so much of the city and had fun going into the many little shops on the way. The motel has an effienct front desk, is clean, and we never had to wait in line to use the shared bathrooms. Some rooms do have private baths, though, I belive. For Venice, the price was right. They let us store our bags the next day for free. It was very clean, compfortable and we loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Marin Venice”
Reviews.Author: didowollongong
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay at Albergo Marin and it's still a great place to stay. Location is excellent, staff helpful, breakfast good and most important of all is it's spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - won't empty the wallet in expensive Venice”
Reviews.Author: WesternWI
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times at Albergo Marin and, as long as your expectations are reasonable, this is a very serviceable small hotel. The location is very good, within several minutes walk of both the train station (one big bridge over the Grand Canal) or bus/car rental location (easier now with one big new bridge instead of 3 small ones). With Venice being fun and easy to get around, all sights and sounds are within easy access of the hotel, by nearby vaporetto or on foot. The city is an adventure. The Marin provides a low-cost option that saves some euros for the exploration. The basic breakfast provides enough of a starter until you find the bakery just a block away! There is a nearby laundromat if needed. While located on the "other" side of the Grand Canal from the train station and such, it's fun to explore the backways between the Marin and the Rialto. The hotel is definitely basic, with limited services and the public areas are not fancy. There is no lift. But the renovated rooms we encountered were clean, with nicely-done bathrooms (sufficient good towels, great shower and also hairdryers). Room size is small (fairly typical), but hopefully you are not spending your vacation time in the room. Generally there appears to be only one front desk person on duty and it may be a part-timer working his/her way through school. The one breakfast attendant seems diligent and is prompt about bringing tea/coffee and fresh croissants. Given the very reasonable rate in a very expensive city, the Marin is a decent option if you keep perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, pleasantly surprised, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: arend24
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised with the Albergo Marin - we got a room with our own bathroom that had a little style and was clean. Nice sized rooms. We only spent one day in Venice and it saved a lot of time lugging baggage around since the hotel was so near the Santa Lucia train station. The bed was comfortable. The only weird thing was leaving the key at the front desk when we left the hotel to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Location is it Selling Point - Lacks Service”
Reviews.Author: FFIGM
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our marriage with an italian vacation. We stay at this property for 3 nights. I had made arrangements via e-mail to have a bottle of prosecco and flowers delivered to the room prior to our arrival. I told them I would pay for the charges. Upon arrival, the items weren't in the room and no one seemed to know what I was talking about. I recognize that this is a one star property, but service is still service. They eventually brought a bottle of prosecco to the room on the first night. They finally delivered the flowers to the room the next morning. I still paid for the extras and no discounts were give for the let down. Prior to our arrival we were upgraded to a newly renovated room with a new hydrating shower. The bathroom renovation was the best part of the room. The rest of the room is forgettable. The coffee is some of the best in the area at breakfast , but this was the highlight of their morning offerings. This hotel is a one star hotel. Book this hotel for it's location - it's extremely close to the bus station, shopping, and the train station. If you are looking for service, decor and breakfast - spend a little more money.

Reviews.Title: “So-so stay at Marin”
Reviews.Author: Gem04
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights during our visit to Venice. The room was very clean and simple, and kept clean daily with fresh towels and bed linen. The hotel has just been refurbished so the bathroom was in very good condition. The only problems we had was no hot water for 2 days, and no air conditioning. The hot water wasn't that much of a problem as it was 35 degrees Celsius whilst we were there, but with air con it was quite sticky in the room, and so with all the windows left open I got bitten lots by mosquitoes, and having them open also made the room quite noisy as we were only on the first floor. Breakfast was fine, nice pastries, but service was at times very slow with only one person waiting on about 10 tables. However, location was good, very close to train station and close to lots of nice restaurants if you know where to go, and for the money I think it is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: laneck
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Albergo Marin based on a review by Rick Steves. We picked the hotel because it was located so close to the train station (only had to cross one bridge), which was really important to four women with large suitcases. I was really scared of what to expect as I had never stayed in a "one star" before. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised. The staff (with the exception of the night desk guy) was incredibly friendly and helpful. Since I booked directly with the hotel, I had emailed "Giacomo" several times with various questions. Not only did he answer all my questions, he even helped me book our hotel rooms in Florence! The hotel was immaculate. I expected really tiny bathrooms, but I was surprised to see that they were comparable to other European hotels. The croissants at breakfast were straight out of the oven. Of course it is not luxurious by any means, but if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Venice close to the train station, then the Albergo Marin is your place.

Reviews.Title: “This is truly a charming hotel with personal service”
Reviews.Author: cbfdoll
Reviews.Content: We love the Marin, since its so close to the railway station and we had come in overnight from Munich. They stored our luggage until we returned in the pm and our entire stay was supported with information, a great breakfast, and ease of coming and going. I recommend it completely and know you'll like the atmosphere of a very nice hotel, with the charm of a small place in an exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of Feb. The location was good - only 5 mins walk from the bus station and across the canal from the train station. We were a short walk from the water bus (Vaporetti) and small cafes. We never had any problems with noise as the neighbourhood was fairly quiet. The staff were helpful on arrival and were happy to answer any questions we had. Our room was on the first floor - a double with bathroom and although basic was ideal for a short stay. We didn't go to Venice to stay in our room! The only negative thing was that the pillows were very thin and hard but the staff were accomodating in trying to find more pillows for us. There were no more so we ended up using blankets instead! The continental breakfast which was included was ok - again basic but did the job - cereal, bread rolls, croissants, coffee, tea, juice....and for an extra charge you could order drinks in your room. Overall good value for money and I would recommend it to anyone staying in Venice on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel for a short-trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Interrailed2007
Reviews.Content: Small rooms with no air-conditioning. Very close to the train station, it's just a short walk once over the bridge and easy to find. It looks alot worse from the outside, but the rooms are clean and quite pretty, the staff are very helpful and there's a great value breakfast (although the coffee is terrible- ask for a cappucino instead!).

Reviews.Title: “Marin a Mistake”
Reviews.Author: tdme
Reviews.Content: one of the Australian guests staying at the Marin camped out in the lobby because she said that watching the staff deal with their reservation mistakes and other problems (no clean towels, no locks on shared bath doors) was like watching Basil in Fawlty Towers. Our party of five was told on arrival that, without explanation, we "couldn't have" our reserved triple with bath and double with shared bath. We were also told that the place was fully booked. When we returned later in the day, we were given a double which still had German guests' personal items in it --- "Basil" was removing their things to the lobby, telling them that they had checked out of the room, when they arrived back from sightseeing to tell him otherwise. Quite a show. Eventually, the clerk got on the phone to the manager, who was offsite until the next day we were told, and lo and behold we end up with three rooms instead of two despite the prior statement of no vacancies. Hotel is also quite beat and certainly deserves no more than its one star rating. At breakfast, we were told that we could have seconds on coffee, and then were ignored until we gave up and left. There have to be better choices for economical minded folks in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Location Ideal”
Reviews.Author: TourismSupport
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated for our needs which was a night in Venice before a cruise. Close to P. Roma and adjacent to the station. Maximum two bridges to navigate. Good value for money, staff helpful and friendly, help with luggage given. Quiet room allocated on the second floor (208) with adequate bathroom and shower. Bathroom accessories and bedroom slippers provided, continental breakfast included which was more than adequate. Happy to keep luggage until departure, and room ready for us on arrival just after noon. Would I recommend or go again? Most definitely...............Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: read this first!”
Reviews.Author: sginsy
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we stayed at while travelling for a month in Europe. The rooms were very uncomfortable, with stained walls and sheets, and peeling wallpaper. Also, there was no elevator. The floor was so old and dirty that we actually were scared to walk barefoot on the floor (see pics). When we asked the unfriendly receptionist about our rooms, we were told that only a few have been renovated and we weren't "lucky enough" to get one. This is also the only hotel whose breakfast we did not eat due to a poor selection and quality of foods. The only pro of this hotel is its proximity to the train station, but that said, we would HIGHLY recommend NOT STAYING at the hotel. (Don't forget to see the pics of our room).

Reviews.Title: “Second time at Albergo Marin”
Reviews.Author: ucla_kat
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Albergo Marin. It is a great find for a budget hotel. If you are looking for the swanky, four-star hotels then this is definitely the wrong hotel for you. Albergo Marin is located about a 5 minute walk across the Grand Canal from the main train station and the water taxis. But you can walk to San Marco Plaza in about 15-20 minutes. The hotel is neat and clean. There is no air-conditioning, but they do provide fans which was sufficient and I've stayed in this hotel in both July and August (previously). The breakfast is good (I love their croissants). It is a great find for a no-frills, budget hotel that is clean and close the main train station.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to train station and airport shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: EdmondOKgal
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed in a triple room with a full bathroom on April 15, 2007. This hotel is within walking distance of the Piazza Roma, where the airport shuttle drops you off. It's even closer to the Santa Lucia train station, so no taxis (water or land) are needed to get to it. Luggage storage is available. Rooms are clean, quiet, and rather small but adequate, and the manager is very friendly and helpful and speaks English well. Our checked luggage did not make it with us, and he made several phone calls to help track it down. A complimentary breakfast buffet is included with various breads, cereals, yogurt, teas, juices, coffee, etc. (no meat or cheese).

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Marin was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kaiwokcam
Reviews.Content: I found out about the Albergo Marin in an April 2006 New York Times series called "Affordable Europe". The reviewer praised the hotel and he was not wrong. It was very cheap for Venice at 100 Euros a night (that included full bathroom) and it is extremely close to the train station which was great since we didn't have to drag our bags on the vaparetto. The staff was very friendly and the included breakfast was delicious. The breakfast had 2 kinds of cereal, grapefruit and orange juice, warm croissants with jelly in them (!) and tasty cappucinos. I was warned that included breakfasts in Europe usually aren't good but this was the exact opposite. The room was relatively small but very clean and very quiet. Absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: all4art
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Marin for three nights at the end of our Italy trip. The good things first: -beds were comfy. We had two twin beds. -breakfast was good- cereal, fresh croissants, hot beverages -nice, helpful staff, spoke english well -Credit or cash payment -fresh towels if desired -wake up call available -good location-- by train/bus station, we could easily find our way back to the hotel after getting lost in the maze of Venice. The bad... -no english tv -toilet down the hall -touchy shower -old fashioned decor reminds me of the 60's -only 1 outlet-- for the tv The hotel wasn't bad. We really were pretty satisfied, though not thrilled. The location is the biggest perk probably. We saw so many people lost in Venice with their luggage-- it was nice to know we didn't have to deal with that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: JamesTK
Reviews.Content: This nice little property is located two blocks from the central train station and is an easy walk, but you will have to cross over the bridge.. If you have lots of luggage wait for the ferry over the Grand Canal. The staff is small, but very caring about their guests. The rooms are small, and not fancy, but at a very good price for Venice. The location is quiet and the beds comfortable. A good breakfast comes with the room. The front is marked, but not with a large sign, and the hotel is on a side street, so you might want to get directions before you travel .. I've added two pictures to this review. Once shows the outside of the hotel, the other the view down the street towards the nearby shops. We plan to stay there the next time we go to Venice. No matter where you stay, book ahead. There is no real off-season in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find”
Reviews.Author: bbyron
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel very easy to get to. This was a big plus after getting off the train and wandering through the station. The hotel's website gave a great little 3D map of how to get there. It only took me 10 minutes on foot with a big backpack. After checking in and dropping my luggage on the bed, I was free to explore the rest of Venice on foot or the vaporetto. Other travelers had to board the vaporetti with their luggage or hire a taxi. The staff was patient and quickly resolved a problem I had with the phone. The breakfast in the morning was acceptable. The single room I stayed in wasn't much more than a glorified dorm room (closet space, small desk, tiny bed, cold tile floor), but I only planned to be in Venice for one night. In late May, the room got a little bit cold and I couldn't find any kind of thermostat or heater. No extra blankets or pillows were in the room. It's my own fault though that I didn't ask the reception desk for extras.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MCC4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Albergo Marin for 3 nights in May. We found it very convinient being so close to the train station and near the vaporetto stops. The staff was very friendly and provided great restaurant suggestions. Only negative was the noise if someone was talking outside late at night. The breakfast was simple but decent and again very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: annika1
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, the inn was extremely clean and the location was very convenient. The train station is about a 5 minute walk and all major sights are within walking distance or easily reached by public transport. Also, the quiet neighborhood provides a nice break from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: xc
Reviews.Content: The Albergo Marin Hotel is a great value for expensive Venice. Our room with private bath was a good size with plenty of storage for your clothes and other items. Very basic room furniture, however it had everything you need, including reading lights above the bed. Gabriella, at the reception desk,was very helpful and provided great restaurant recommendations. The hotel is no more than a 10 minute walk from the train station. A basic but adequate breastfast is provided. Would stay at this hotel again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location very near the train station. Paid 70 Euros for a single night reserved over the phone. Simple clean rooms that appear to be recently refurbished (although bed was just okay). Room 107 didn't have much of a view though. The guy running things in the evening was very friendly and helpful. Definitely would recommend to others.

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo Marin
HotelInfo.Address: Ramo delle Chioverete, Santa Croce, 670/b, 30135 Venice, Italy
